p: In the case of the glutinone molecule, 32 binding targets were obtained in Homo sapiens, with binding probabilities between 12% and 100%. The first three results shown in Table 11 have been selected since they have a probability of between 23% and 100% of being targets of the glutinone molecule. The remaining results for targets with binding probabilities less than 23% are not displayed. Of all the targets analyzed, cycloxigenase 1 (100%), cytochrome P450 (54%), and cathepsin D (23%), showed the highest probability of being glutinone binding targets.
